Parallel Computing

Source: vignettes/scalability.Rmd
scalability.Rmd
library(PETLER)
## Loading required package: survival
TrainCode <- data_org$TrainCode
TrainCode[, monthstd := month / fu_time]  
TrainCode
##            id  fu_time month pred1 pred2 pred3  monthstd
##      1:     1 49.41273     0     0     0     0 0.0000000
##      2:     1 49.41273     1     0     0     0 0.0202377
##      3:     1 49.41273     2     0     0     0 0.0404754
##      4:     1 49.41273     3     0     0     0 0.0607131
##      5:     1 49.41273     4     0     0     0 0.0809508
##     ---                                                 
## 810620: 20600 24.70637    20     0     0     0 0.8095080
## 810621: 20600 24.70637    21     0     0     0 0.8499834
## 810622: 20600 24.70637    22     0     0     0 0.8904588
## 810623: 20600 24.70637    23     0     0     1 0.9309342
## 810624: 20600 24.70637    24     0     0     2 0.9714096
colSums(TrainCode[, 4:6])
##  pred1  pred2  pred3 
## 165843  67354  19437
f <- function(code, ngrid = 401) {
  x <- seq(0, 1, length.out = ngrid)  
  pred <- TrainCode[[code]]
  TrainNP <- pred[pred > 0] 
  month <- rep(TrainCode$month, pred)
  t <- monthstd <- rep(TrainCode$monthstd, pred)
  h1 <- bw.nrd(t)
  h2 <- bw.nrd(t)^(5/6)  
  times <- rep(NA, 3)
  names(times) <- c(1, 2, 4)
  times[1] <- system.time(FPC.Kern.S(x, t, TrainNP, h1, h2, n_core = 1))["elapsed"]
  times[2] <- system.time(FPC.Kern.S(x, t, TrainNP, h1, h2, n_core = 2))["elapsed"]
  times[3] <- system.time(FPC.Kern.S(x, t, TrainNP, h1, h2, n_core = 4))["elapsed"]
  hist(month, xlab = "Time (months)", main = code, las = 1)
  hist(monthstd, xlab = "Time (standardized)", main = code, las = 1)  
  barplot(times, col = "lightblue", xlab = "CPU Cores", 
          ylab = "Seconds", main = code, las = 1)  
  times
}
par(mfcol = c(3, 3))
time1 <- f("pred1")
time2 <- f("pred2")
time3 <- f("pred3")

cbind(time1, time2, time3)
##    time1  time2 time3
## 1 38.225 18.276 5.614
## 2 18.432  8.832 3.077
## 4  9.064  4.365 1.760
